text: Gertrude Chandler Warner (16 April 1890 - 29 August 1979) was an American writer. She wrote the popular Boxcar Children books. She was criticized for showing children with little parental supervision. Her critics thought that this would cause child rebellion. She was born in Putnam, Connecticut. == Other websites == * About Gertrude Chandler Warner *Article about the Gertrude Warner Museum *Biography of Warner and information about Boxcar Children * * Category:19th-century writers from Connecticut Category:1890 births Category:1979 deaths
title: Gertrude Chandler Warner
